_header: Solomon sat and said many sooth saws
_description: ‘Prouerba Solomonis’ — 35 lines, generally in 6-line stanzas (aaaabb) with an ‘0 and I’ refrain

CULGg132.First Lines:
Salamon sat & sayde many soth sawysWordis þat walkys wyde
                    by wyndowes & by wawys…
CULGg132.Last Lines:
…With an O & an I þus men gedyrrys godeCatel cummys
                    & catel gase ryth as dos þe fflode
CULGg132.Editions:
Brunner,  Karl. 
             “With an O and an J. I.” 
             Anglia
         54 (1930): 288-91: 291.

CamGon84.First Lines:
Salamon þe wyse says in hys sawysWordys walkon full wyde be
                    woundys & be ways…
CamGon84.Last Lines:
…With a o and I invi to hym þai haueqwar to mak us he hit
                    so sum tyme he was bot a knaue
CamGon84.Note:
Stanzas of 4, 3, 3, and 4 lines, monorhyming, with two-line
                    ‘o’ and ‘I’ refrains.
